result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert J Boettiger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Plus Supervision Fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect the debt.  You must  keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.
Will comply with all conditions imposed by DOC

records.addlTxt: Defendant Robert J Boettiger in court with attorney Annette M. Barna.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case settlement has been reached in this matter.  Court recites case settlement into the court record.  Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  Court is satisfied will accept waiver.   Ct 1 will be amended to misd battery, enhancers will be dismissed, Ct 2 enhancers will be dismissed, sentence will be withheld, 2 yrs probation, DE will comply with DOC recommendations, will pay CC.  DE will enter plea's of NC to amended Ct 1 and Ct 2, court will accept and find the DE guilty.  Court will accept the recommendations of the parties, make case settlement an order of the court.  Has credit for 3 days.  Will report to DOC today.
Defendant Robert J Boettiger in court with attorney Annette M. Barna.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Adjourn to 4-28-15 @ 11:00AM
Review hearing on March 17, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Defendant Robert J Boettiger in court with attorney Annette M. Barna.  Rachel Payne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Offer just made, set for 3-17-15 @ 10:00AM for RH.
Review hearing on February 10, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Robert J Boettiger in court with attorney Annette M. Barna.  Rachel Payne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waive reading of the information, enter plea of NG.  Set for review 2-10-15 @ 3:00PM

Defendant Robert J Boettiger in court with attorney Annette M. Barna.  Andrea Amidon Nodolf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE will waive prelim hearing scheduled for today.  Court instructs on waiver of prelim. hearing, court will accept waiver.  Court finds probable cause, will bind over for JT.  Set for 1-05-15 @ 2:00PM, arraignment.
Preliminary hearing on November 7, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Robert J Boettiger in court with attorney Annette M. Barna.  Rachel Payne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waive formal reading of Criminal Complaint. DE/Atty will waive time imits for prelim hearing.  Set for PH 11-07-14 @ 10:00AM. Bond continues.
Amended Summons filed by the State (5 copies to DA)
